revised_title: Meteorological Observations at Various Heights in India
tldr: The author discusses meteorological observations taken at various heights in India, focusing on Dodabetta on the Neelgherry Mountains, 8640 feet above sea level. The observations were conducted to study the diurnal oscillation of the barometer in relation to elevation above sea level. The author found that the daily oscillation of the barometer was regular, with the maximum pressure occurring in March and the minimum in June. The study also compared the pressure data with other locations in India, such as Madras, Bombay, and Calcutta.
